comment: Would not recommend if you want an easy class. She assigns a ridiculous amount of work.

I liked her class, but there was a lot of work that had to be completed for this class. Their are about 16 daily assignments (about 2-3 assignments a week). She drops the two lowest though. You also have to complete an annotated bib. and two essays. Since this was a hybrid class you could only miss one class without it effecting your grade
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I was doing well in this class at first, but through a combination of the professors lack of thorough instructions, and not really understanding what I was doing half of the time, my grade began to decline. She assigns a ridiculous amount of at home work, gives no extra credit, and makes it very difficult to learn. She is very funny, though.

Really nice professor! Took for a hybrid. Had lots of work each week but overall was graded pretty easily. You can only miss one class before she takes off of your grade. 1 annotated bibliography and 2 papers through semester. She is very helpful throughout semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She's a tough grader and strict on what she expects but is clear in what she wants and is more than willing to help. Overall, she's a professor who genuinely cares about her students, both in their learning and their lives in general. She bumped me up a few extra points to an A even though I honestly deserved the B I had.

I took Prof VanHeirseele last semester for English 1101 and this semester for 1102.  She makes her expectations pretty clear and the class isn't all too difficult as long as you do the essay assignments as instructed and show up to class.  You can only miss a certain amount of days before it affects your final grade, as in every English class.

She is a tough grader but will give you good feedback. There are 4 essays in total, 3 online discussions and dull homework. She drops your 2 lowest in class grades. Save your money and share the textbooks, you will only need them once or twice. Sometimes her classes are boring, but if everyone looks tired, she gives the class a 5 min water break.

She is a tough grader only because she challenges you to write a well developed argument and won't take anything less. There are only four main assignments. 3 Essays and 1 Annotated Bib. I took her hybrid class and attendance is super important. Miss two classes and you drop a letter grade. All in all, she's a good teacher.

She was an amazing teacher and always willing to assist me on papers and other homework assignments. She also told us that she drops the two lowest homework grades at the end of the year, but the work wasn't too terrible, so if you did the work, showed up, and took the time to do the papers, you got a decent grade. I'm taking her 1102 next semester

I love Professor V. She is nice and takes time to explain things. She is reasonable but tough on deadlines. Make sure you come to class on time and don't play on your phone. I enjoyed her class and would take her again.

this teacher does not explain what she wants for her assignments well. she gives to much work at one time. she always want us to write about things we don't care about and her lecture are very boring. do not take her if you do not like English because she will put you to sleep

Though others may regard her grading as tough, she looks for substance in papers, rather than length.  Her lectures are great- she is always open for a good laugh.  The class includes three essays, one annotated bibliography and a final essay. Overall, she is strict on attendance but going to class is worth it!
